sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Andretti Acquisition Amends Underwriting Terms for StoreDot Deal
feed.summary: Andretti Acquisition Corp. II (POLE) has amended its underwriting agreement with BTIG, LLC concerning its proposed business combination with StoreDot Ltd. The amendment reduces deferred underwriting commissions to $8 million, with the payment structure dependent on the closing cash level of the StoreDot transaction. BTIG also gains equity-based fees, registration rights, and rights of first refusal on future financing and SPAC IPOs involving Andretti.

feed.title: Andretti Acquisition II Signs Underwriting Agreement Amendment With BTIG
feed.summary: Andretti Acquisition II (POLE) has amended its underwriting agreement with BTIG, modifying deferred underwriting fees related to its business combination with StoreDot. The amendment sets deferred commissions at $8.0 million, with payment terms dependent on the closing cash amount. BTIG also receives registration rights, a right of first refusal for future financing, and a right of first refusal for future SPAC IPOs by the sponsor group.

feed.title: Andretti Acquisition Corp. II (NASDAQ:POLE) Trading Down 0.2% - Time to Sell?
feed.summary: Andretti Acquisition Corp. II (NASDAQ:POLE) saw its share price drop by 0.2% during Friday's mid-day trading, reaching $10.50. Trading volume was significantly lower than average, with only 903 shares traded compared to the daily average of 146,190. The stock currently holds a "Sell" rating from analysts, and several institutional investors have recently adjusted their positions in the company.

feed.title: Andretti Acquisition Corp. II Announces Merger Agreement
feed.summary: Andretti Acquisition Corp. II has announced a Business Combination Agreement with StoreDot Ltd. and other entities, aiming to merge under a new publicly traded company (Pubco) on Nasdaq. The transaction is valued at $800 million and includes additional cash from StoreDot’s financing. This merger is intended to strengthen their market position in the electric vehicle and battery technology sectors.

feed.title: Andretti Acquisition Corp. II Announces Merger with StoreDot
feed.summary: Andretti Acquisition Corp. II (POLE) and StoreDot Ltd. have announced a definitive Business Combination Agreement, leading to a merger that will create a new public company (Pubco). This merger aims to advance StoreDot’s extreme fast charging battery technology and enhance its market position for electric vehicles. The completion is contingent on various conditions and potential financial hurdles.

feed.title: StoreDot, Andretti Acquisition Corp. II (NASDAQ: POLE) to form $882M XFC Battery company
feed.summary: StoreDot and Andretti Acquisition Corp. II (NASDAQ: POLE) have signed a definitive agreement to merge, forming a Nasdaq-listed holding company named XFC Battery. This transaction, valuing StoreDot at $800 million pre-money equity and a pro forma enterprise value of $882 million, aims to commercialize StoreDot's Extreme Fast Charging (XFC) batteries for electric vehicles. The XFC technology promises 100 miles of charge in 5 minutes, with a roadmap to 3 minutes, leveraging an asset-light licensing model compatible with existing lithium-ion production lines.

feed.title: StoreDot Ltd. agreed to acquire Andretti Acquisition Corp. II in a reverse merger transaction for $800 million.
feed.summary: StoreDot Ltd. has agreed to acquire Andretti Acquisition Corp. II in an $800 million reverse merger. The transaction will result in the formation of a new holding company named "XFC Battery," whose shares are expected to be listed on the Nasdaq Stock Market. The deal, which has been unanimously approved by the board, is anticipated to close in the second quarter of 2026.

feed.title: Andretti Acquisition, StoreDot enter definitive business combination agreement
feed.summary: StoreDot and Andretti Acquisition Corp. II have entered into a definitive business combination agreement, forming a new holding company called "XFC Battery," which is expected to be listed on Nasdaq. This transaction values StoreDot at an implied pre-money equity value of $800 million, and its XFC technology can deliver 100 miles of charge in just 5 minutes. The acquisition is anticipated to close in the second quarter of 2026, subject to various approvals and conditions.

feed.title: StoreDot Ltd. and Andretti Acquisition Corp. II Announce Signing of Definitive Agreement for Business Combination to Accelerate the EV Revolution with Extreme Fast Charging Battery Technology
feed.summary: StoreDot Ltd., a leader in Extreme Fast Charging (XFC) battery technology for electric vehicles, and Andretti Acquisition Corp. II have signed a definitive business combination agreement. The new entity, XFC Battery, aims to commercialize StoreDot's XFC batteries to eliminate EV charging anxiety, offering 100 miles of charge in 5 minutes. The transaction values StoreDot at an $800 million pre-money equity value, with existing shareholders rolling over their equity.

feed.title: StoreDot Ltd. and Andretti Acquisition Corp. II Announce Signing of Definitive Agreement for Business Combination to Accelerate the EV Revolution with Extreme Fast Charging Battery Technology
feed.summary: StoreDot Ltd., an Israeli pioneer in Extreme Fast Charging (XFC) battery technology for electric vehicles, and Andretti Acquisition Corp. II have signed a definitive business combination agreement. The combined entity, to be named "XFC Battery," aims to commercialize StoreDot's XFC batteries to eliminate EV charging anxiety, offering 100 miles of charge in 5 minutes. The transaction values StoreDot at an $800 million pre-money equity value, with the combined pro forma enterprise value expected to be $882 million.

feed.title: StoreDot Ltd. and Andretti Acquisition Corp. II Announce Signing of Definitive Agreement for Business Combination to Accelerate the EV Revolution with Extreme Fast Charging Battery Technology
feed.summary: StoreDot Ltd., a leader in Extreme Fast Charging (XFC) battery technology, and Andretti Acquisition Corp. II have signed a definitive business combination agreement. This merger aims to accelerate the adoption of EVs by commercializing StoreDot's XFC batteries, which can provide 100 miles of charge in just 5 minutes. The combined entity will be named "XFC Battery" and is expected to be listed on Nasdaq, with a pro forma enterprise value of $882 million.

feed.title: StoreDot Ltd. and Andretti Acquisition Corp. II Announce Signing of Definitive Agreement for Business Combination to Accelerate the EV Revolution with Extreme Fast Charging Battery Technology
feed.summary: StoreDot Ltd., a leader in Extreme Fast Charging (XFC) battery technology, and Andretti Acquisition Corp. II have signed a definitive agreement for a business combination. This merger, valuing StoreDot at $800 million pre-money equity, aims to accelerate the commercialization of StoreDot's XFC batteries to address the challenge of long charging times for electric vehicles. The combined entity will focus on mass-market adoption and is expected to close in the second quarter of 2026.

feed.title: Andretti Acquisition Corp. II Announces Merger with StoreDot
feed.summary: Andretti Acquisition Corp. II (POLE) announced a definitive Business Combination Agreement with StoreDot Ltd. on December 3, 2025. This merger will combine both companies under a newly formed public entity, Pubco, aiming to leverage StoreDot's advanced battery technology for market enhancement and commercialization efforts. StoreDot specializes in extreme fast charging battery solutions for electric vehicles, and the merger's completion is subject to various conditions and potential financial challenges.

feed.title: With 53% ownership, Andretti Acquisition Corp. II (NASDAQ:POLE) boasts of strong institutional backing
feed.summary: Institutional investors own 53% of Andretti Acquisition Corp. II (NASDAQ:POLE), indicating strong professional backing and potential influence on the stock price. The top 7 shareholders collectively hold 52% of the business, with hedge funds accounting for 17% and a private company, Andretti Sponsor II LLC, holding 19%. The general public has a 10% ownership stake.
